intro: Malvaviscus multiflorus, commonly known as the red mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, red bracts that resemble flowers, though they are actually modified leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Malvaviscus multiflorus thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
